block.p: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Westchester and Putnam Counties this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com, or by mail to Westchester Cultural Calendar, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036-3959.
COMEDY

Cuddebackville ''The Art of Late Night Comedy,'' with Chris Regan, comedian and former writer for ''The Daily Show With Jon Stewart''; presented by the Neversink Valley Area Museum. May 20 at 4:30 p.m. $5. D & H Canal Park, 58 Hoag Road. (845) 754-8870.
Tarrytown Susie Essman, stand-up; benefit for the Rockland Country Day School. Friday at 8 p.m. $45 to $375. Tarrytown Music Hall, 13 Main Street. (877) 840-0457.

Valhalla ''The Mid-Life Crisis Comedy Tour,'' with Buzz Nutley, Jim Brogan, Cathy Ladman and Brad Upton, stand-up. May 19 at 8 p.m. $18 and $22. Westchester Community College, Academic Arts Theater, 75 grasslands Road. (914) 606-6262.
FILM

New Rochelle ''Yentl,'' directed by Barbra Streisand; with a discussion and buffet dinner. Thursday at 7 p.m. $15 to $25; reservations required. Beth El Synagogue-Center, 1324 North Avenue. (914) 235-2700.
Nyack ''Silver City,'' directed by John Sayles; followed by a discussion with Mr. Sayles and producer Maggie Renzi. May 19 at 4 p.m. $25 to $50. Riverspace, 119 Main Street. (845) 348-0741.

Pleasantville ''Out at the Movies,'' series of lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender films. Schedule and information: burnsfilmcenter.org. Friday through May 31. $6 to $13. Jacob Burns Film Center, 364 Manville Road. (914) 773-7663.

Suffern International Film Festival, presented by Finkelstein Memorial Library: ''Kinky Boots,'' directed by Julian Jarrold. Tuesday at 7 p.m. $1 and $3. Cultural Arts Theater, 145 College Road. (845) 732-8186.

Valhalla ''The Sea Inside,'' directed by Alejandro Amenábar; in Spanish, with English subtitles. Friday at 8 p.m. $8 and $9. Westchester Community College, Academic Arts Theater, 75 Grasslands Road. (914) 606- 6262.
FOR CHILDREN
Hudson Music From China, contemporary and traditional Chinese music; family concert. May 19 at 3 p.m. Free. Hudson Opera House, 327 Warren Street. (518) 822-1438.
Nyack Milk and Cookies Playhouse, with musicians, jugglers, puppet shows and food: The Circle Song Band with Sukey Molloy. May 19 at 10 a.m. $7 and $9. Riverspace, 119 Main Street. (845) 348-0741.

Shrub Oak ''Salomé,'' reading of a play adapted from Oscar Wilde's drama; presented by M and M Productions. May 20 at 2 p.m. Free. John C. Hart Memorial Library, 1130 East Main Street. (914) 245-5262.

White Plains ''A Village Fable,'' family musical adapted from the book ''In the Suicide Mountains,'' by John Gardner; presented by the Play Group Theater. Ages 10 and up. May 13 through 20. $15. White Plains Performing Arts Center, 11 City Place. (914) 328-1600.
Yonkers ''Music and Merriment,'' children's program. Ages 2 to 5. Through June 20. Yonkers Crestwood Library, 16 Thompson Street. (914) 337-1500, Extension 360.

Yonkers ''Mother Goose Time,'' nursery rhymes, stories songs and finger plays. Ages 2 to 4. Through Thursday. Free; registration required. Yonkers Public Library, Grinton I. Will branch, 1500 Central Park Avenue. (914) 337-1500.
MUSIC AND DANCE
Annandale-on-Hudson Bard College Orchestra; works by Bach, Vivaldi and Mozart. Friday at 8 p.m. Free. Olin Hall, Bard College. (518) 537-6665.
Annandale-on-Hudson Bard College Symphonic Chorus and Chamber Singers; works by Handel. Wednesday at 8 p.m. $5. Richard B. Fisher Center for the Performing Arts, 30 Campus Road. (845) 758-6822.
Bronx Albert Einstein Symphony Orchestra; works by Beethoven. May 20 at 3 p.m. Donation. Robbins Auditorium, Albert Einstein College of Medicine, 1300 Morris Park Avenue. einsteinorch.tripod.com.
Cold Spring Cristina Fontanelli, soprano. May 20 at 4 p.m. Donation. Chapel of Our Lady Restoration, 45 Market Street. (845) 265-5537.
Katonah ''Ringing in the Spring,'' performance by the hand bell group Katonah Celebration Ringers. May 20 at 2 p.m. $12. John Jay Homestead Historic Site, Route 22. (914) 232-5651.

Mount Kisco Westchester Oratorio Society; Purcell's ''Dido and Aeneas'' and Bach's cantata choruses. May 19 at 8 p.m. $20 and $40. Presbyterian Church of Mount Kisco, 605 Millwood Road. (914) 763-9389.

Nyack Mother's Day concert by the Claremont Trio; with light brunch available. May 13, noon to 2 p.m. $5 and $12. ''Songwriters by the River in the Riverspace Cafe,'' with Joe D'Urso and Andy Krikun, singer-songwriters, and others. Friday at 8 p.m. $10. Riverspace, 119 Main Street. (845) 348-0741.

Peekskill Stephen Stills, rock and folk guitar, and his band; with Jay Boy Adams. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. $51 to $71. Los Pleneros de la 21, Puerto Rican music and dance. Friday at 7 p.m. $10 to $20. The Derek Trucks Band, folk. May 19 at 8 p.m. Sold out. Paramount Center for the Arts, 1008 Brown Street. (914) 739-2333.

Purchase Clancy Newman, cellist. May 13 at 3 p.m. $17.50 to $35. Cherryholmes, bluegrass. Friday at 8 p.m. $20 to $40. The Westchester Philharmonic. May 19 and 20. $22 to $67. Annual student showcase by City Dance Center. May 20 at 10:30 a.m., 2 and 5:30 p.m. $20. Performing Arts Center, 735 Anderson Hill Road. (914) 251-6200.
Tarrytown ''Of Thee We Sing,'' musical look at American government by the Westchester Chordsmen. May 19 at 2:30 and 7:30 p.m. $20 and $25. Tarrytown Music Hall, 13 Main Street. (877) 840-0457.

White Plains ''Something to Laugh About,'' humorous music by Beethoven, with Adam Kent, pianist and music director. May 20 at 3 p.m. $10 and $15. Community Unitarian Church, 468 Rosedale Avenue. (914) 232-3394.
White Plains ''Noonday Getaway,'' free concert series: Elizaveta Kopelman and Anna Gourfinkel, pianists. Wednesday at 12:10 p.m. Free. Grace Church, 33 Church Street. (914) 949-2478.
White Plains Westchester Guitar Festival. Friday at 2 p.m. $15 and $20. Music Conservatory of Westchester, 216 Central Avenue. (914) 761-3900.
Yonkers Yonkers Male Glee Club. May 20 at 3 p.m. Free. Yonkers Public Library, Grinton I. Will branch, 1500 Central Park Avenue. (914) 337-1500.
OUTDOORS
Yorktown Heights Annual Yorktown Community Day, with pony rides, demonstrations and games. May 19, noon to 5 p.m. Mildred E. Strang Middle School, 2701 Crompond Road. (914) 243-8100.
SPOKEN WORD
Rye Meg Cabot, author of ''The Princess Diaries''; discussion, question-and-answer session and signing. May 20 at 4 p.m. Rye Free Reading Room, 1061 Boston Post Road. (914) 967-0480.
THEATER
Bedford Hills ''Wild Party,'' musical presented by the Infinity Repertory Theater Company. Friday through May 20. $12. Pulse Performing Arts Studio, 196 Route 117, Bypass Road. (914) 241-0200.

Irvington ''Honk!'' musical version of '' The Ugly Duckling,'' by George Stiles and Anthony Drewe; presented by the Broadway Training Center of Westchester. Through May 13. $12 and $20. Irvington Town Hall, 85 Main Street. (914) 591-6602.
Stony Point ''Half and Half,'' comedy by James Sherman. Friday through June 10. $15 to $30. Penguin Repertory Company, 7 Crickettown Road. (845) 786-2873.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES

Armonk ''Frank Lloyd Wright and Usonia: An Experiment in Living.'' Through June 24. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. The Studio: An Alternative Space for Contemporary Art, 2 Maryland Avenue. (914) 273-1452.

Beacon Photography and mixed media by Christopher Staples; halogen light installation by Augustine Della Vecchia. Through June 3. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 6 p.m. Beacon Artists Union (bau), 161 Main Street. (845) 440-7584.
Beacon ''Fly Away Little Bird,'' multimedia exhibition by Monica D. Church. Through May 27. Hours: Fridays through Sundays, noon to 6 p.m. Go North: A Space for Contemporary Art, 469 Main Street.

Beacon '' Models on Main Street,'' photography group show. Through June 3. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 6 a.m. to 10 p.m.; Fridays, 6 a.m. to 11 p.m.; Saturdays, 7 a.m. to 11 p.m.; Sundays, 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. Muddy Cup Coffee House, 129 Main Street. (845) 440-8855.
Bronx ''Transit,'' video installation by the artist, choreographer and musician Eleanor Dubinsky. Through June 9. Donation: $5. Bronx River Art Center, 1087 Tremont Avenue. (718) 589-5819.
Bronx ''Sugar Buzz,'' mixed-media group show. Through Tuesday. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Lehman College Art Gallery, Bedford Park Boulevard West. (718) 960-8731.
Bronx ''Caribbean Gardens: Journey to Paradise,'' plant exhibition and related events. Through Sept. 16. $5 to $20. New York Botanical Garden, Bronx River Parkway and Fordham Road. (718) 817-8616.

Bronx ''Emily Dickinson Rendered,'' mixed-media group show of art inspired by the poetry of Emily Dickinson. Through May 25. $2 to $4; members and under 6, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Wave Hill, 675 West 252nd Street. (718) 549-3200.

Dobbs Ferry ''From Spain to Avalon,'' mixed media exhibition. Through May 22. Free. Hours: Sundays through Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. St. Cabrini Nursing Home, 115 Broadway. (914) 693-6800, Extension 522.
Dobbs Ferry Sculptures by Sondra Gold. Through May 27. Hours: Thursdays through Sundays, 12:30 to 5:30 p.m. Upstream Gallery, 26 Main Street. (914) 674-8548.

Kingston ''Set the Stage,'' exhibition of set, costume and poster designs. Through May 26. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 1 to 6 p.m. Arts Society of Kingston Arts Center, 97 Broadway. (845) 338-0331.

Mount Vernon ''Overlooked Hero: John Glover and the American Revolution,'' historical documents and prints; ongoing. St. Paul's Church National Historic Site, 897 South Columbus Avenue. (914) 667-4116.

New Paltz ''From Impressionist to Modernist: The Paintings of Woodstock Artist Charles Rosen.'' Through May 20. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Samuel Dorsky Museum of Art, SUNY New Paltz. (845) 257-3844.

New Rochelle ''Byron Goto: A Retrospective,'' mixed-media exhibit. Through June 17. Hours: Tuesdays and Wednesdays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Thursdays and Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Castle Gallery, 29 Castle Place. (914) 654-5423.

North Salem ''Brush with Nature,'' group exhibition featuring traditional and modern brush painting techniques. Through June 5. Hammond Museum and Japanese Stroll Garden, 28 Deveau Road. (914) 669-5033.

Ossining ''Local Color 10,'' annual group show sponsored by the Croton Council on the Arts. Through May 25. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Thursdays, to 8 p.m. Art Barn, 211 North Highland Avenue Route 9.
Peekskill ''The Art of Persuasion,'' prints from The New York Society of Etchers. Through June 29. Paramount Center for the Arts, 1008 Brown Street. (914) 739-2333.
Pelham Paintings by Liang Guo. Through June 23. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Pelham Art Center, 155 Fifth Avenue. (914) 738-2525.
Poughkeepsie Photography by Claudia Gorman. Through June 10. Guided daily house tours. Through Nov. 30. $6 and $9. Locust Grove, 2683 South Road (Route 9). (845) 454-4500, Extension 17.

Purchase ''Fugitive Artist: The Early Work of Richard Prince, 1974-77.'' Through June 24. ''Lesley Dill: Tremendous World,'' installations. Through June 3. ''New Media: When,'' group show. Through May 20. $3 to $5; members and children 12 and under, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Neuberger Museum of Art, 735 Anderson Hill Road. (914) 251-6100.

Rye ''Spotlight on Historical Costumes,'' a collection of seasonal costumes. Through June 7. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. Square House Museum, 1 Purchase Street. (914) 967-7588.

Scarsdale ''Words: From Spoken to Seen,'' paintings by Wosene Worke Kosrof. Through June 30. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Madelyn Jordon Fine Art, 14 Chase Road. (914) 723-8738.

A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Westchester and Putnam Counties this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com, or by mail to Westchester Cultural Calendar, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036-3959.
